00030    class CosineDihedral : public ParamComposite

00136    // Inline method definitions
00137    
00138    /* 
00139    * Return dihedral energy.
00140    */
00141    inline
00142    double CosineDihedral::energy(const Vector& R1, const Vector& R2,
00143           const Vector& R3, int type) const
00144    {
00145       Vector u1, u2;
00146 
00147       u1.cross(R1, R2);
00148       u1 /= u1.abs();
00149 
00150       u2.cross(R2, R3);
00151       u2 /= u2.abs();
00152 
00153       return ( kappa_[type] * (1.0 + u1.dot(u2)) );
00154    }
00155 
00156    /* 
00157    * Return:
00158    *    F1 = d energy / d(R1)
00159    *    F2 = d energy / d(R2)
00160    *    F3 = d energy / d(R3)
00161    * for use in MD and stress calculation.
00162    */
00163    inline
00164    void CosineDihedral::force(const Vector& R1, const Vector& R2,
00165         const Vector& R3, Vector& F1, Vector& F2, Vector& F3, int type) const
00166    {
00167       Vector u1, u2, tmp1, tmp2;
00168       double r1, r2, cosPhi;
00169 
00170       u1.cross(R1, R2);
00171       r1 = u1.abs();
00172       u1 /= r1;
00173 
00174       u2.cross(R2, R3);
00175       r2 = u2.abs();
00176       u2 /= r2;
00177 
00178       cosPhi = u1.dot(u2);
00179 
00180       tmp1.multiply(u1, -cosPhi);
00181       tmp1 += u2;
00182       tmp1 *= kappa_[type] / r1;
00183 
00184       tmp2.multiply(u2, -cosPhi);
00185       tmp2 += u1;
00186       tmp2 *= kappa_[type] / r2;
00187 
00188       F1.cross(R2, tmp1);
00189 
00190       F2.cross(tmp1, R1);
00191       tmp1.cross(R3, tmp2);
00192       F2 += tmp1;
00193 
00194       F3.cross(tmp2, R2);
00195    }
00196 
00197 } 
00198 #endif
